title: Lag spikes (AT&T) please read and help!
body:
http://www.speedtest.net/result/6416147776.png  speed test I did wired a while ago (using wired didn't fix issue)

http://www.speedtest.net/result/6460996141.png wireless new test (currently what im using)

During game I'm getting lag spikes between 150-300ms , and it is like clockwork.

I did a ping test to 216.52.241.254 and sure enough every so often (after about the same amount of time) the ping shoots up. It's funny because the spike is just for a second but its soooo annoying and noticeable. 

I have DMZ on this IP, and in no other game is this happening. 

What can I do? 

I've flushed my DNS and even tried google DNS servers, no luck.

replies.body:
Still no resolution. They are sending the 4th "technician" here again tomorrow. 

Please, for the life of you, never go with ATT Fiber Optics.

Tracing route to riotgames-17.ext1.lax.pnap.net [216.52.241.254]
over a maximum of 30 hops:
  0  ME
  1  xx
  2  99.173.218.46
  3  99.133.13.86
  4  99.133.13.123
  5  12.83.101.149
  6  12.122.104.69
  7     *        *        *
Computing statistics for 150 seconds...
            Source to Here   This Node/Link
Hop  RTT    Lost/Sent = Pct  Lost/Sent = Pct  Address
  0                                           ME
                                0/ 100 =  0%   |
  1   30ms     0/ 100 =  0%     0/ 100 =  0%  xx
                                0/ 100 =  0%   |
  2   34ms     0/ 100 =  0%     0/ 100 =  0%  99.173.218.46
                                0/ 100 =  0%   |
  3   22ms     0/ 100 =  0%     0/ 100 =  0%  99.133.13.86
                                1/ 100 =  1%   |
  4   13ms     1/ 100 =  1%     0/ 100 =  0%  99.133.13.123
                               99/ 100 = 99%   |
  5  ---     100/ 100 =100%     0/ 100 =  0%  12.83.101.149
                                0/ 100 =  0%   |
  6  ---     100/ 100 =100%     0/ 100 =  0%  12.122.104.69

Trace complete.




Edit:

Did it a second time and it was the same thing 
HERE:
  4   13ms     1/ 100 =  1%     0/ 100 =  0%  99.133.13.123
                               99/ 100 = 99%   |

Which is also within the AT&T network

Contacted ATT they just keep telling me to reset my modem, like for real dude?

Sorry for such a late response! Even poros gotta sleep xD.

It definitely looks like your connection is hitting a rough spot in this line 

> 4 13ms 1/ 100 = 1% 0/ 100 = 0% 99.133.13.123
> 99/ 100 = 99%

That's some pretty heavy packet loss, and it sucks your ISP isn't really willing to work with you. Go ahead and reach out to our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and they might be able to give a little more info as to what the problem is at that point, but ultimately it looks like this issue lies with you ISP.

Yeah, I'm sending the support guy at riot some more info he requested. Hopefully he can figure it out.

Today, it doesn't seem bad at all. One lag spike doing a ping test.

AT&T sent a guy out here today, he literally did nothing. Told him my issue and he said that isn't something he can fix, and I'm like I know... I told them to cancel you coming and direct me to someone who can handle this lol.
Made a ticket, doubt it will be fixed though. Oh well

Any help would be appreciated!

ATT was zero help

Instead of ping run:
pathping 216.52.241.254

Post the results here and I will assist in locating the issue and next steps.
